workflow.name: Track Jira epic health with automated risk alerts via Slack, Monday & Sheets
workflow.description:
## Description:
Transform your Jira project management workflow with this intelligent n8n automation template that continuously tracks, scores, and reports the health of Jira Epics.

The automation runs every 6 hours, fetches all active Epics, analyzes linked issues for performance, quality, and stability metrics, and automatically flags at-risk Epics. It updates Jira fields, sends alerts to Slack, logs trends in Google Sheets, and syncs visibility with Monday.com‚Äîensuring teams stay proactive, not reactive.
Ideal for agile teams, project managers, and product owners looking to monitor delivery health, detect risks early, and maintain transparent reporting across tools.

## ‚úÖ What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)
‚è± Trigger Every 6 Hours: Automatically executes every six hours to keep health data updated in near real-time.
üì• Fetch All Epics from Jira: Retrieves all Epics, their keys, and fields via the Jira API to establish a full analysis scope.
üîÄ Split Epics for Processing: Converts the batch of Epics into individual items, enabling sequential metric analysis.
üîó Fetch Linked Issues: Collects all issues linked to each Epic, capturing their types, statuses, cycle times, and labels for deeper health analysis.
üìà Calculate Health Score: Computes a weighted score (0‚Äì1 scale) based on:
 ‚Ä¢ 40% Average Cycle Time
 ‚Ä¢ 30% Bug Ratio
 ‚Ä¢ 20% Churn (Reopened issues)
 ‚Ä¢ 10% Blocker Ratio
 Scores above 0.6 indicate at-risk Epics.
‚öñÔ∏è Decision Gate: At-Risk or Healthy: If the health score exceeds 0.6, the workflow automatically initiates corrective actions.
üîß Update Jira Epic: Updates Jira with the computed health score and adds an ‚ÄúAt Risk‚Äù label for visibility in dashboards and filters.
üö® Send Slack Alerts: Notifies the #project-alerts channel with Epic details, health score, and direct Jira links for immediate attention.
üìã Update Monday.com Pulse: Syncs health metrics and risk status back to your Monday board, maintaining cross-platform transparency.
üìä Log to Google Sheets: Appends health score logs with timestamps and Epic keys for trend analysis, audits, and dashboard creation.

## üß† Key Features
 ‚úîÔ∏è Automated Jira Epic health scoring (cycle time, churn, bugs, blockers)
 ‚úîÔ∏è Real-time risk flagging with Slack alerts
 ‚úîÔ∏è Integrated cross-tool visibility (Jira + Monday + Sheets)
 ‚úîÔ∏è Continuous trend tracking for performance improvement
 ‚úîÔ∏è Secure API-based automation

## üíº Use Cases
 üí° Track project delivery health and spot risks early
 üìà Build executive dashboards showing team velocity and quality
 ü§ù Align product and engineering with shared visibility
 üßæ Maintain a compliance audit trail of Epic health trends

## üì¶ Required Integrations
 ‚Ä¢ Jira Software Cloud API ‚Äì for Epic and issue data
 ‚Ä¢ Slack API ‚Äì for real-time team alerts
‚Ä¢ Monday.com API ‚Äì for visual board updates
 ‚Ä¢ Google Sheets API ‚Äì for historical tracking and analytics

## üéØ Why Use This Template?
 ‚úÖ Prevents project delays by flagging risks early
 ‚úÖ Provides automated, data-driven Epic health insights
 ‚úÖ Connects your reporting ecosystem across platforms
 ‚úÖ Perfect for Agile and DevOps teams driving continuous improvement

workflow.name: Jira Epic Health Score & Risk Dashboard

parameters.content:
üìä WORKFLOW START

This workflow monitors Jira Epics and calculates health scores:

‚Ä¢ Runs every 6 hours
‚Ä¢ Fetches all Epics
‚Ä¢ Analyzes linked issues
‚Ä¢ Calculates health metrics
‚Ä¢ Flags at-risk epics
‚Ä¢ Updates dashboards
‚Ä¢ Alerts team via Slack

üì• EPIC RETRIEVAL

Fetches all Epics from Jira:

‚Ä¢ Uses Jira REST API
‚Ä¢ getAll operation
‚Ä¢ Retrieves: Epic keys, names, fields
‚Ä¢ Filters to Epics only

Returns list of all Epics in project
Passed to Split Epics for processing

üîÄ SPLIT EPICS

Transforms Epic batch into individual items:

‚Ä¢ Iterates through each Epic
‚Ä¢ Extracts Epic key
‚Ä¢ Creates separate object per Epic
‚Ä¢ Enables sequential processing

Input: Array of Epics
Output: Individual Epic objects with key

Allows detailed analysis per Epic

üîó FETCH LINKED ISSUES

For each Epic, retrieves:

‚Ä¢ Epic metadata
‚Ä¢ All linked child issues
‚Ä¢ Issue details:
  ‚úì Status
  ‚úì Issue type (Bug/Task)
  ‚úì Labels (blocker, etc)
  ‚úì Cycle time metrics
  ‚úì Custom fields

Used to calculate health metrics

üìà HEALTH SCORE ALGORITHM

Weighted formula (0-1 scale):

metrics calculated:
‚úì avgCycleTime: Average days/hours
‚úì bugRatio: Bugs / Total issues
‚úì churnRatio: Reopened / Total
‚úì blockerRatio: Blockers / Total

Weights (importance):
‚Ä¢ avgCycleTime: 40% (velocity)
‚Ä¢ bugRatio: 30% (quality)
‚Ä¢ churnRatio: 20% (stability)
‚Ä¢ blockerRatio: 10% (dependencies)

Score 0.0 = Healthy
Score > 0.6 = At Risk ‚ö†Ô∏è

‚ö†Ô∏è RISK THRESHOLD

Condition: healthScore > 0.6

Interpretation:
‚Ä¢ Score 0.0-0.6 = Healthy ‚úÖ
‚Ä¢ Score > 0.6 = At Risk ‚ö†Ô∏è

If AT RISK:
‚Üí Update Epic in Jira
‚Üí Add "At Risk" label
‚Üí Alert team via Slack
‚Üí Log to Monday & Sheets

If HEALTHY:
‚Üí No action needed

üîÑ JIRA UPDATE

Updates at-risk Epic:

‚Ä¢ Sets custom field:
  customfield_10060 = Health Score
‚Ä¢ Adds label: "At Risk"
‚Ä¢ Creates audit trail
‚Ä¢ Visible in Epic view

Team sees risk status immediately in Jira
Enables auto-filtering by label

üö® SLACK ALERT

Sends to: #project-alerts

Contains:
‚úì Epic key
‚úì Health score value
‚úì Direct link to Epic in Jira
‚úì Timestamp (automatic)

Enables real-time team notification
Critical for risk mitigation
Allows quick team action

üìã MONDAY.COM PULSE

Updates Monday.com board with:

‚Ä¢ Health score metric
‚Ä¢ Risk status
‚Ä¢ Last updated timestamp

Syncs data across platforms
Keeps Monday boards current
Pulse shows real-time metrics

Note: Requires Monday.com credential setup

üìä GOOGLE SHEETS LOG

Appends historical record:

Columns (A:C):
‚úì Timestamp
‚úì Epic Key
‚úì Health Score

Used for:
‚Ä¢ Trend analysis
‚Ä¢ Risk history
‚Ä¢ Compliance audit
‚Ä¢ Dashboard creation
‚Ä¢ Performance tracking

Builds dataset over time

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
